page.title: 19Farming in Littlehampton
page.content: There is a large concentration of glasshouses in and around Littlehampton which produce goods ranging from tomatoes through to early vegatables and mushrooms. The Horticultural branch of farming in this area employs a great deal of casual labour especially during the picking season. The more traditional farming landuse is devoted to the growing of cereal crops especially wheat and to the growing of rape seed which now gives many of the fields its distinctive yellow colour. The types of animal farming in this area is dominated by dairy cattle ,pigs and poultry.The farmers use the water meadows on either side of the river Arun for the dairy herds as the land here is unsuitable for cereal crops.
